article_title: Southern Democrats Walk a Tightrope With Black Voters
article_text:
In Louisiana, Sen. Mary Landrieu says President Barack Obama’s energy policies are “simply wrong.” In North Carolina, Sen. Kay Hagan has criticized the administration’s handling of veterans’ benefits. And in Georgia, Senate candidate Michelle Nunn won’t say whether she would have voted for the Affordable Care Act.

These Democrats, like others running in races across the country, are trying to distance themselves from a president who...

twitter.description: Democrats running for Senate in the South are trying to motivate black voters while keeping President Obama at arm’s length, and sometimes even criticizing him outright.
twitter.title: Southern Democrats Walk a Tightrope With Black Voters

image.alt: Reaching out to black voters, with Obama at arm’s length
